title: Accountant Job at La Roche Equipment Nigeria Limited
content:
La Roche Equipment Nigeria Limited is a building materials and equipment company that provides innovative solutions to many leading contracting companies in the region.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Lagos

Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Prepare and examine accounting records, financial statements, and other financial reports to assess accuracy, completeness, and conformance to reporting and procedural standards.
	Manage all accounting transactions
	Ensure timely bank payments and monitor bank deposits.
	Handle monthly, quarterly, and annual closings.
	Reconcile accounts payable and receivable.
	Ensure timely submission of tax returns and liaise with external auditors during audits.
	Analyze financial information and summarize financial status.
	Prepare the schedules for statutory remittances (PAYE, WHT, Pension, Company tax, ITF, NSITF, among others) and ensuring timely remittance.
	Maintain a complete and accurate Fixed Asset Register for the company
	Provide technical support and advice on management.
	Participate in financial standards setting and in forecast process.
	Develop and document business processes and accounting policies to maintain and strengthen internal controls.


Requirements


	HND/Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance
	Minimum of 7 years of proven experience as an Accountant in a trading company or related industry.
	Must have ICAN certification
	Thorough knowledge of Accounting procedures and principles.
	Experience with general ledger functions and the month-end/year-end close process.
	Hands-on experience with accounting software packages
	Advanced MS Excel skills including Vlookups and pivot tables.
	Accuracy and attention to detail.
	Aptitude for numbers and quantitative skills.
	Excellent organizational and time-management abilities.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: careerslrn@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Vacancies at Duob Recruitment
content:
Duob Recruitment, a recruitment firm, is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Junior Mechanical Engineer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Overview


	We are recruiting a Junior Mechanical Engineer to assist in maintaining production machinery, improving efficiency, and supporting senior engineers in various technical operations.


Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Carry out routine maintenance and repairs on manufacturing equipment.
	Assist in the setup and calibration of machines.
	Track and report equipment performance and issues.
	Work closely with the production team to ensure smooth operations.
	Ensure compliance with safety and environmental regulations.


Requirements


	BSc / HND qualification in Mechanical Engineering.
	5 - 7 years of experience in a plastic or footwear production environment.
	Familiarity with injection molding or extrusion processes.
	Technically sound and willing to learn.
	Strong attention to detail and teamwork abilities.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 18th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: hrdamilolaasoata@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Head of HR (Manufacturing)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Overview


	Our client is hiring a Head of Human Resources to lead the people operations of a dynamic plastics manufacturing company.
	This person must be a strategic HR leader with a strong manufacturing background, capable of aligning HR with business goals.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead HR planning, talent acquisition, performance management, and staff development.
	Enforce labor law compliance and internal policy implementation.
	Manage employee relations, disciplinary procedures, and staff welfare.
	Monitor HR metrics and provide reports to management.
	Coordinate payroll and benefits in collaboration with finance.
	Drive employee engagement and build a culture of accountability and growth.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business Admin, or Industrial Relations (Master’s/CIPM is a plus).
	15+ years of experience,must include manufacturing industry HR leadership.
	Excellent knowledge of Nigerian labor law and workforce dynamics.
	Strong leadership, communication, and decision-making skills.


Salary
N500,000 per month. 

Application Closing Date: 11th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: damilola@toncorporateservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

3.) Senior Accountant

Job Locations: Lagos & Port Harcourt - Rivers
Reports To: Chief Operating Officer
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Accountant to oversee and manage the financial operations of our diverse business portfolio, including pharmacies, supermarkets, and hair & beauty salons.
	The ideal candidate will ensure the accuracy of financial records, compliance with regulatory requirements, and provide critical financial insights to support strategic decision making.
	This Role will require supervising over night stock count process, occasional weekend work due to the nature of the businesses. Also work during public holidays due to the nature of the businesses.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Management:


	Prepare, review, and analyse financial statements, ensuring accuracy and compliance with regulatory standards.
	Maintain the general ledger and oversee monthly, quarterly, and annual closing processes.
	Reconcile accounts, including bank statements, receivables, and payables.
	Manage and monitor cash flow to ensure sufficient funds for operations. Budgeting and Forecasting
	Develop, manage, and monitor budgets for all business units.
	Provide detailed variance analysis and recommend corrective actions.
	Ensure compliance with financial regulations and company policies. Internal Controls and Auditing
	Develop and enforce effective internal controls to safeguard business stock.
	Include developing processes and policies such as procurement process, internal audit plan
	Prepare financial forecasts and business performance reports. Taxation and Compliance
	Ensure compliance with local tax regulations, including VAT, PAYE, and corporate taxes.
	Prepare and file accurate tax returns and liaise with tax authorities when necessary.
	Develop an accounting manual • Coordinate and support internal and external audit processes.
	Identify risks and propose improvements to financial processes. Team Leadership and Collaboration
	Supervise and mentor junior accounting staff, fostering professional growth.
	Collaborate with department heads to provide financial guidance and support decision making.
	Liaise with external auditors, tax consultants, and regulatory bodies.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5-7 years of accounting experience, with at least 2 years in a senior role.
	Professional certifications such as ACA, ACCA, ICAN
	Experience in the retail or service industry is an advantage.


Skills and Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, financial reporting, and Nigerian tax laws.
	Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel.
	Strong organisational and time-management skills.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.


Benefits


	HMO
	Annual Leave


Application Closing Date: 15th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@duobrecruitment.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Guest Relations Officer Job at Vista Lux Hospitality & Resorts
content:
VistaLux Hospitality & Resorts is a modern and elegant hospitality brand built with the purpose of delivering unforgettable experiences to both local and international guests. We specialize in creating a peaceful and luxurious environment where relaxation meets comfort. Whether it's a weekend getaway, a business trip, or a family vacation, we provide well-designed spaces, top-class customer service, and a warm atmosphere that makes every guest feel special.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Our services include high-end hotel accommodation, resort-style experiences, event hosting, tour packages, and travel support. Every branch of VistaLux is carefully planned to reflect beauty, class, and comfort. From our stylish rooms and delicious cuisine to our friendly staff and clean environment, we always put our guests first.At VistaLux, we don’t just offer hospitality, we create a lifestyle of ease, peace, and luxury. Our goal is to become one of the leading hospitality names that people trust, love, and look forward to. Whether you’re a traveler, tourist, or partner, VistaLux is where comfort meets elegance

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Guest Relations Officer
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a Guest Relations Officer to provide high-quality service to our hotel customers.
	You will address complaints and go the extra mile to make sure our guests are satisfied.
	In this role, you should be an excellent communicator who can stay positive when facing difficult situations.
	You should also be reliable and customer-oriented, as you’ll serve as a primary point of contact for our customers.
	Your goal will be to ensure our guests enjoy themselves and plan to come back to our facilities.


Duties and Responsibilities


	Review arrival lists to welcome guests
	Attend to special guests (e.g. VIPs) and answer their inquiries
	Help prepare welcome folders with collateral (e.g. room service menus, area descriptions)
	Provide information about amenities, area and venues and promote services
	Anticipate guest needs and build rapport with customers
	Offer assistance with certain tasks (e.g. confirming travel arrangements, taking messages)
	Address customers complaints.
	Record information in the logbook daily
	Ensure compliance with health and quality standards


Requirements and Skills


	Interested candidates should possess a relevant qualifications.
	Familiarity with hospitality industry standards.
	A customer-oriented and professional attitude
	An outgoing personality
	Outstanding communication abilities
	Excellent organizational and time-management skills.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 Monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: vistaluxhr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Senior Sales Engineer Job at Fave Consulting
content:
Fave Consulting is a Human Resources Management and consultancy firm that specializes in strategic HR management to enhance business growth, performance and transformation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Sales Engineer
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Ensure to meet business goals in terms of product sales, sales growth, market share improvement, profitability, and customer satisfaction in the assigned territory.


Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Grow Sales: Achieve agreed sales budget for the company.
	Develop sales in the assigned geographical territory through direct sales visits and contracted freelancers if any.
	Strictly follow & implement a guided sales strategy to achieve the growth and sales targets.
	Develop and maintain positive relationships with established customers through close management of the accounts and attention to their needs.
	Assess and define customer applications so that the correct product can be represented. Ensure integrity in the application of the products.
	To promote RPM brands with value sales process.
	Protect and promote sales price positioning and premium.
	Achieve the Gross Contribution of min. 30%.
	Reporting: To report, (daily, weekly & monthly) using sales tools and databases, activities, and information collected in the market (customers, competitors, actions in progress).
	Interact actively with customers to become their consultant in selling our products.
	Follow-up on existing customer showing high degree of commitment and professionalism.
	Set and maintain coherent and clear sales activity agenda.
	Support sales through undertaking sites survey and providing technical advice to both existing and new potential customers.
	Continuously improve technical knowledge on product technologies and applications.
	Support the complete sales process with prospecting, discussions, demonstration, exhibition, reference selling, and negotiation to achieve the target.
	Maintain regular contact with all customers. Spend 70% of your time meeting existing potential customers & finding new potential customers. And 30% of your time for negotiations (closing the quick wins – immediate prospects).


Requirements


	BSc or HND in any related field but an added advantage in Electrical, Mechanical, and Industrial Engineering.
	A minimum of 5 years of corporate B2B direct selling in CMC industries (Cement, Minning & Construction)
	Experience in sales of machines and parts (Compressors, Pumps, valves, conveyors, belts and other heavy machinery parts).
	Experience in a manufacturing or engineering company Proven records of high-performance sales.
	Proven experience selling in the CMC industries (Cement, Minning & Construction).
	Enjoys the art of selling and be willing to go hands-on when required.
	Ambitious and performance-driven personality.
	Sound judgment and good business sense.
	Teamworking ability.
	The ability to build relationships with clients quickly.
	Analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Resilience and tenacity.


Salary
N500,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV & cover letter in PDF to: recruitment@faveconsulting.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

We specialize in creating a peaceful and luxurious environment where relaxation meets comfort. Whether it's a weekend getaway, a business trip, or a family vacation, we provide well-designed spaces, top-class customer service, and a warm atmosphere that makes every guest feel special.

Our services include high-end hotel accommodation, resort-style experiences, event hosting, tour packages, and travel support. Every branch of VistaLux is carefully planned to reflect beauty, class, and comfort. From our stylish rooms and delicious cuisine to our friendly staff and clean environment, we always put our guests first.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant Assistant Manager
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a Restaurant Assistant Manager to ensure all daily activities run smoothly and efficiently.
	Restaurant Assistant Manager responsibilities include ordering kitchen utensils and equipment based on our needs, managing contracts and payroll and supervising restaurant staff performance.
	To be successful in this role, you should be familiar with restaurant operations and have a good understanding of what makes a great customer service. You should also be available to work within opening hours, including weekends and holidays.
	Ultimately, you will help minimise operating costs, boost our employee retention and deliver a positive dining experience for our guests.


Responsibilities and Duties


	Research new wholesale food suppliers and negotiate prices.
	Calculate future needs in kitchenware and equipment and place orders, as needed.
	Manage and store vendors’ contracts and invoices.
	Coordinate communication between the front of the house and the back of the house staff.
	Prepare shift schedules.
	Arrange for new employees’ proper onboarding (scheduling training and ordering uniforms).
	Process payroll for all restaurant staff.
	Supervise kitchen and wait staff and provide assistance, as needed.
	Keep detailed records of daily, weekly and monthly costs and revenues.
	Monitor compliance with safety and hygiene regulations.
	Gather guests’ feedback and recommend improvements to our menus.


Requirements and Skills


	Good Customer service attitude.
	Communication and team management abilities.
	Availability to work within opening hours (e.g. evenings, holidays, weekends).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: vistaluxhr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
